title: Ticket #4191: Abort DAG after a specified number of node failures
description:
Brian Bockelman wants to be able to abort a DAG after a specified number of node failures, even if the DAG could make forward progress.

This should be pretty easy, since we already keep a running count of the number of failed nodes. So we just have to add a knob for the user, and check that each time through the event/submission loop, I guess.

My initial thought is to have something like this: 

  DAGMAN_MAX_NODE_FAILURES = 5

If we used that terminology, I think that a value of 0 would mean that the DAG would be aborted on the first node failure, and a negative value would disable this setting.
remarks:
2014-Jun-12 14:18:31 by wenger:
Maybe it would be better to have a macro like DAGMAN_ABORT_ON_FAILURE; then 0 would mean don't abort, 1 would mean abort on the first failure.

We'd also have to define whether a node that fails and then succeeds on a retry counts as a failure -- my initial thought is to say no.
